website_summaries.verdict: Affordable kid-friendly model whose design holds up well to the wear and tear of an active little life.
pros: Kids earn virtual badges and see on-screen celebrations when goals are met
cons: Only five days of battery life, and the animated screen can be a battery drain

customer_reviews.title: Love the product. Band rips easily
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the Ace 2 for our daughter for the alarm feature. Due to health reasons she needs the reminders. That was easily setup and it has performed wonderfully. However, the band tore after one week of owning. It looks like the band was not made to withstand any play sadly. I tried purchasing less expensive replacement bands and they unhook and do not stay locked in. So now we are forced to purchase a $29 replacement "fitbit" band in order to use product. Hopefully next one will be more durable and this just was a defect.
customer_reviews.author: lj

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Love the product! My 9 year old Just got this as a gift from Ya for his birthday BUT just like the other reviews the wrist band is already detaching from the bumper area around the fit bit in less than a week :( and to replace it is $30!!!! I would think with the product this expensive and for children that there would be a better quality wristband on it rather than thin silicone. Very disappointing for my child and myself in my wallet. Considering returning the whole product and just getting my money back.
customer_reviews.author: SHANNON CHASE

customer_reviews.title: Broke very fast
customer_reviews.text: Broke after less than 2 months of regular use. The strap fell apart while my kid was playing outside on her bike. Pretty bummed that I now have to buy a replacement strap for her to keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: Teej

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! It does not work! Its needs a firmware update to work and the company has no idea as to when the update will work!
customer_reviews.author: Rose PeLong

customer_reviews.title: Great Motivation for the Whole family!
customer_reviews.text: Love this kids Fitbit. Our 7 year old daughter had this topping her birthday gift list and we bought her this in mid June. She loves participating in family challenges and she’s always pushing us to get more steps in because she’s an active kid. It has been great for all of us and the fact that it’s water proof takes away a ton of worry! I would love to see the battery life improved a little, but we are extremely happy with this purchase! We did a lot of research prior to this purchase and I’m happy we did!
customer_reviews.author: Adam and Andrea Burton

customer_reviews.title: Band broke within 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch Band broke within 2 weeks Spent 45 min on phone trying to get another one sent. Customer service was helpful but too much time taken to report and fix problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great value and WATERPROOF!!!
customer_reviews.text: A good value for a kids activity tracker. Worth the wait and the interface is very kid friendly. We will see how well it holds up (especially the cheap looking bracelet) but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great way to motivate
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old daughter absolutely loves this tracker. Now only does it look nice but the reminders to move and get ready for bed have made it such a nice addition! Plus her determination and competitiveness has given me the motivation I needed too!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Cornette

customer_reviews.title: Dislike watch band compared to original Ace band
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son. Our daughter has the original Ace. The Ace 2 has great new features compared to the original (Waterproof and timers), but I dislike the band very much. If my son takes his watch off, the FitBit part falls out the back very easily. The original Ace seems much more durable. While we haven’t actually had problems with the band, it isn’t great by any means.
customer_reviews.author: HoppyCat

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible With Chromebooks
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for each of my kids. The initial setup kept failing on my kids chromebook laptops (we bought them for the kids for school work and general internet access). After it kept failing, I called customer support and they stated that Chromebooks aren't yet "tested" and they won't work with the Ace 2 (my Charge 2 and Charge 4 Fitbits work with my Pixel phone so I didn't figure there would be a problem). Double checking, there isn't any up front or obvious notification in the description that it doesn't work with Chromebook devices. There should be better representation of what works and does not work in the description so consumers can make a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Johns

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit doesn't care to help
customer_reviews.text: If you ever lose, misplace, or have your device stolen Fitbit will willingly allow someone else to pair your device to their account and will offer no support in locking your device or tracking if it has been re-paired. If you contact them they will hide behind "privacy policies" about information on your own device. The app has no internal locator/search function, you have to rely on third party apps. Plan on buying multiple if your child wears this.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with the tracker, the app doesn't work to be able to use it
customer_reviews.text: I have a fitbit for myself and got one for my child, however the app is garbage and I cant set up my child's fitbit because you have to switch over to "kid view" to set it up. However, you get stuck in a never ending "spin" cycle on the app. I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app and contacted Fit-bit support, to be told "it is a known problem and it'll get fixed when it gets fixed...."
customer_reviews.author: Tina Lupton

customer_reviews.title: Band breaks very easily!
customer_reviews.text: Ya'll this band breaks so easily! 2 months in and it already snapped. My child begged for a Fitbit for months and we finally got him one for his 6th Birthday! He hasn’t wanted to take it off since it arrived. He’s had a blast getting his steps in, trying to beat our steps for the day, swimming. telling time, etc. Sucks that the band is broken and he can't use this anymore
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Watt

customer_reviews.title: Decent kids Fitbit.  Hard to charge.  Would expect more the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice kid friendly Fitbit. It works well and my kid loves it. It’s sturdy and durable. The downsides are that the charger is very hard to use. The contact points have to be absolutely perfect to charge. This gets very frustrating. The band is also weak. It broke within a few months. Which is a shame for something supposedly designed for kids. Finally, the step count is quite inaccurate. It appears to count 30% more steps than are actually taken.
customer_reviews.author: Sumeet Jain

customer_reviews.title: Does what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this on a whim because we were curious about how much our ADHD boy walks throughout the day and we have not been disappointed! He loves it and it has encouraged him to want to exercise versus play with his Pokemon cards all day. One note I have to parents - it has been more effective when worn on the ankle and it is less likely to be played with. It does have the added benefit, when worn on the ankle, of looking like a house arrest anklet and boy has that been a fun trick to play on people.
customer_reviews.author: Brittni

customer_reviews.title: Worst tracker
customer_reviews.text: The worst tracker I've ever had for my little kid! When we synced it, it had saved steps on it already even though it's a brand new one! Sometimes it has weird readings of activities or sleep patterns! It doubles up steps and does not count sleeping hours! I contacted the customer service of Fitbit but they do nothing to address these problems seriously!!!! I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah

customer_reviews.title: It’s nice
customer_reviews.text: I love the watch so much it is awesome!! 👏🏻 I kinda wish it would show how many calories I burned, like when I go play tennis 🎾 but it’s ok. It also does show how many mins I have been active though and the other down side is i have a very hard time syncing the watch, I like to compete against some of my friends on the “work week hustle” but otherwise definitely should buy!!! I hope this is helpful 😊 😀 Update: have had for a few months now, it’s stills great, except syncing is still an issue. Also this band breaks out my wrist..looking at getting a different one not made of silicone
customer_reviews.author: Mindi Bergsma

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch but you need a cellphone for your child to sync it.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this! My 10 year old doesn't have a cellphone, so I thought she'd be able to use her fire tablet. NOPE! NOT compatible! Wish I had looked into it further before I bought this. Can't sync it to the tablet so she can't join family challenges or check on her stats. Booooo....
customer_reviews.author: Islndgrl80

customer_reviews.title: Good Fitbit for kids to enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: It works well and my child can see their steps and we can see how much active sleep they get (if worn while sleeping). It’s also a nice watch for them to have in addition to the health impact!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Not working after only a few months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson and for a few months (4) it was his favorite thing. But it slowly stopped working. it should still be under warranty but Amazon refers you to the manufacturer and on the Fitbit website they seem to only want to deal with you and honor the warranty if you bought it from the Fitbit site. Or else you must call them which has been difficult. I did not expect this to be a problem from such a big company who sells their products from so many other vendors than themselves. VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Biased Fitbit Lover!
customer_reviews.text: I am a lover of Fitbit, so I may be biased! I got this for my daughter, to encourage her to move during quarantine. She loves it and will wear it everywhere (even the pool!) I only wish that there was a better way to keep her data on a seperate device (she doesn't have a phone and her tablet wasn't compatible with the app). Not a huge issue, but just makes it more difficult to keep up with. Also, the accuracy (not really Fitbits fault) is off, because she can pump her arms to get steps, lol!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My 10-year-old loves this! Got it for Christmas and has put it though the paces. Very durable! Great little watch. The app allows you to set up a family and he can’t add anyone to his friends unless I do it. We do family challenges (good luck beating a kid that never slows down!). He gets badges and trophies. It’s a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: eoddavid

customer_reviews.title: Band is crap
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a promising product for our 6-year old daughter, but the band buckle falls apart so easily it seems it needs to be reassembled when putting it back on her. For an adult, this would be a pitiful example of product quality. For a rough-and-tumble young child? A brand-name reputable product, not some Kickstarter prototype? Is there a 3rd party band that's worthwhile? I see other posts mentioning $30 to replace; I wouldn't give half that for what this thing came with.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lunsford

customer_reviews.title: Tracker works just as described
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old wanted a Fitbit because I wear mine all of the time. I love this tracker, does all that I can do (sleep tracking, activity tracking etc.) and has safety features for a young kid that I love. The "guardians" on the account have to approve any friend requests; even people that the kids request themselves, and my daughter can only post an avatar (vs a photo). Very safe and does what it needs to do. The family challenges are also fun.
customer_reviews.author: action0099

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working both times...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd tracker I've had for my daughter. Both times now it has stopped working after only a few months. Resetting it does not work so now I'm not sure what to do. The return window has closed on this replacement tracker so I'm stuck with a broken product.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 7 year daughter. She loves it. Most of her friends have them. Seems to keep tracks, reporting is great and it keeps her interested in her daily activity. Water proof too, as she uses during swim team practice. Battery life is great. Lasts several days on 1 charge. Color watermelon seems to be the most popular for younger girls..
customer_reviews.author: Victor G.

customer_reviews.title: Works OK for Children
customer_reviews.text: I have bought my 9 yr old other versions of an activity trackers and they were terrible. The FitBit Ace is a step above other brands. You can add your child’s tracker to your FitBit family account. The reason I am giving it only 3 Stars is I expected so much more from a name brand tracker. I feel it does accurately track steps or activity, which is something that lesser brands also seem to do. Let’s hope that since Google is buying FitBit, they will remedy this issue for the Ace.
customer_reviews.author: GrammyT

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: The band caused a terrible rash on daughters wrist. Customer service was no help at all. Their response was to see doctor and stop wearing... gee thanks! My adult daughter needed that strictly bc of the size of her wrist asked customer service if there was another product that we could use without it making contact with skin? Only response was to keep area dry and remove every few days- it’s like they do not read correspondence.
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Band is defective
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 9 year old daughter and it worked just fine, but the band did not hold the actual device well and it fell out. The band was on her wrist with no device and we don't know when it fell out. She is mostly around the house and does not play games that are high impact, so this is very disappointing. I called fitbit customer service and they won't do anything about it. So BEWARE! We are super disappointed with their "service." Our neighbor bought a lesser expensive activity tracker for her 8 year old son and it is much more durable than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality even for a sensory kid
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my sensory kiddo. He is 11 and keeps it very loose by it still tracks sleep well. The Fitbit app is a bit wonky if I log into his account view then switch back to mine. I out my password in again which is no big deal. It keeps my kiddo out of the adults version. However it then treats me like a new member (with history) and gives me tutorials and beginner hints. I dislike that. I've had Fitbit for many years. Still I love it for my kiddo. I just check his sleep on his phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hallum

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 5-year-old. I absolutely love it, and she does too. We use it for the alarm reminders, this way I can control when she has alarms, so she knows when to get back to virtual learning. Very easy to use. My only complaint is it does not sync with her fire tablet. So I have to log her in and out on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Band isn’t durable.
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for Christmas and it keeps falling off. We were out shopping and he realized it wasn’t on him, luckily we found it but it fell off 2 more times. I made sure it was on right. Battery life is good and app is good. He still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt N Lynze

customer_reviews.title: Needs more detailed break down reports
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product. We wanted to buy it to track kid’s sleep. It does the job, but only wish there could be more detail break down of it. For example, it tells u how many times the kid is restless per night, but doesn’t tell you the exact time and I can’t see details of how long the child is restless each time.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Durable, awesome for our 6 year old with ADHD
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old son loves this watch. We initially got this to track his sleep to make sure he was getting enough sleep at night. But soon we realized with his ADHD he was using it to track time and setting time limits for himself which made a huge difference at school for him. Being able to track time and the length of different activities was incredibly beneficial for helping him get through the day. The strap has not broken, it's been very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hitchcock

customer_reviews.title: cute watch but band is iffy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 8 year old granddaughter in August. A few weeks ago, the green band that you put the pink band thru broke. Seems like it was too soon to expect it to break. She really loved the watch - so we need to find a new band. Her parents were able to set everything up for her and monitor it.
customer_reviews.author: kathy k

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my daughter as a Christmas present last year. We are an extremely active family and she wanted some way to track her progress. She never slept in it so we don't know if the sleep tracker is accurate. It has never kept time correctly and in the last month and a half it has gotten to where it will only display the incorrect time; nothing else. Don't waste your money. Find something else that works better.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G.

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping.
customer_reviews.text: So this product might work better for older kids, but my six year old doesn't have a smart phone (and won't for some time). It doesn't really work unless they have their own device. It counts her steps and activity well enough, but to be able to access data conveniently, the whole I terface would need to be overhauled first time. Should've gone with the Disney one by Garmin I think.
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: The watch stopped working in less than two months
customer_reviews.text: It was a waste of money and a big disappointment. The watch stopped working in less than two months of very moderate use. Just didn't turn on after being fully charged. An attempt to keep my kid active had failed. Inaccurate readings for sleep and steps. A cute animal face on the watch wasn't worth $60 to pay. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but needs better battery life
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy is great and does a good job of measuring my son running around. Sleep tracking doesn't really work because it needs to be charged overnight. The mobile app isn't bad but is always pushing for you to buy more content or devices. My son uses it to watch his steps and for the time.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Recieved the wrong color
customer_reviews.text: While the device is fine. I ordered a teal one and a watermelon colored one and recieved two watermelon. My sons not super happy about the "pink" band. I could return it but hes 5 and hes been wanting this fitbit for a couple months now and doesnt want me to return it so he has to wait longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 10 year old son as a birthday gift. He loves it and wears it daily. I’m very impressed by the way it’s made and is kid friendly to use. My son gets excited to count his steps and it’s encouraged him to become more active while doing so.
customer_reviews.author: ashley farmer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little gadget for a 6 year old
customer_reviews.text: I bought This for my 6 year old. I synched It to my app. She can tell time on it easily and see her steps. She isn’t using the other features yet. I like To see how many steps she took in a day and track her sleep patterns. When she goes back to school After break we will set up the alarm feature.
customer_reviews.author: AndreaT

customer_reviews.title: Score!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this just over a week now. My almost 8 year old loves it, and wears it dailys. He really likes tracking his steps and the silent alarm for school. No issues. Would recommend to others. And quick shipping
customer_reviews.author: Cute but crazy

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge!
customer_reviews.text: This fitbit was purchased in late January as a gift and will not charge. Instructions said to clean it, but it did not help. This was purchased for my Grandson whose birthday party was on the 16th of February. It lasted 14 days. According to the shipper they only guarantee this product for 30 days from the date of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: duffer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old loves this watch but it’s missing the notch to keep the band closed, as he plays and moves around his band constantly comes loose and I worry he will lose it. I have the Charge 2 and the notch comes on all of the bands to keep the watch secure. It makes no sense why they wouldn’t have that feature on a kids watch.
customer_reviews.author: Shae Brown

customer_reviews.title: Super cool gadget that kids love
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Christmas gift for a friends kid. He absolutely loves it. He’s a pretty active guy but the mom says, this fit bit makes he do even more and it’s cool how it tracks sleep patterns. I think it’s a great idea that would keep kids active from an early age.
customer_reviews.author: Marina G

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Opened out of box brand new, followed all exact instructions. Couldn’t get past a black screen with a horizontal line on it. We charged it and tried everything that was instructed. Ultimately, it never worked, maybe defective? I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not up to par
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working this week, can’t get the screen to turn on even though it’s fully charged and vibrates when you hit side button.
customer_reviews.author: Erin C.

customer_reviews.title: Watch face kept popping out
customer_reviews.text: We liked the watch, but I bought it for my 10 year old and the face just kept popping out. I wish I would’ve returned it within the 30 day period, because now we’re 15 days out of the exchange allowance, and the face popped out again and we can’t find it. Very frustrating. If this happens to you, make sure to return right away. My other son has the same watch and we’ve never had this problem. I think we just got one that was messed up from the beginning. Other than that, we have liked the watch but I wouldn’t buy this kind again.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferS

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Looked cute and all and I’ve had fit bits for a long time without ever a problem. This one was bought for my grandson who loved to run. It just stopped working completely and the return window closed yesterday- bought it for his Christmas gift 😞😞
customer_reviews.author: Lydia C. Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Band broke in less than 4 months
customer_reviews.text: My seven year old daughter loves this tracker. She wears it everyday and loves it. However, the band has already broken twice. First, the end of the band broke which was no big deal because she could still easily wear it without getting bothered. Now, more pieces have started coming off (see attached picture). Fitbit, is it possible to get a replacement band?
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Kid Tracker with not enough features
customer_reviews.text: The feel of the band of the tracker feels REALLY nice. That pretty much the best attribute. The steps and sleep tracking is fine, but for the steep price why not include HR, which most other bands out there include without question.
customer_reviews.author: 3fan

customer_reviews.title: Best Fitbit for little kids
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is loving her Fitbit Everyone in the family has one and she was missing the challenges and is easy to keep track how is she sleeping and how active during the day
customer_reviews.author: BAE

customer_reviews.title: Works great!! Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! My 8 year old loves it! Only takes it off to charge 1 x per week! Tracks her sleep, steps, has bed time and brush teeth alarms (I set them up) and it is so nice. No rash on her arm like the cheaper ones we have tried! Wish I would have bought the read fit bit brand much sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: My kid loves this
customer_reviews.text: Super fun! Very nice design. My kid loves this item. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Leta H.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids to keep active.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this to keep track of her steps. Syncing with the app is a bit annoying as it can only sync to one device but that is more of a software problem. For the kids it’s great. Light weight and keeps them active. I also like that we can get additional bands that she can swap out with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fast delivery,kids proof,we love it
customer_reviews.text: I got this fitbit for my nephew who is 8 years old and not very active..he loves it, watchimg his sleeping hours and his steps all the time. walking more with it just to get more steps:) We are doing challenges together :)Im happy he is more active and he is happy to have more steps than me
customer_reviews.author: Kalina

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I got this fitbit for my daughter and sofar it has been working like a charm and was easy to setup. It saves you buying a watch for your kid as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed I. Salem

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend this product it is fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this watch. It is great for him to track your steps and keep him motivated. I would definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Sukaina Manekia

customer_reviews.title: Great watch but replace the band
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch and Fitbit in general. we got our kids Fitbit ace2 for Xmas and the bands it came with was giving them like a weird chemical burn or something. Bought a different band and haven’t had any issues
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Dooley

customer_reviews.title: Kid Durable
customer_reviews.text: Great FitBit for daughter. Easy set up with the app. Battery lasts for 3-4 days and seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: ASHLEY COONEY

customer_reviews.title: Causes glitches in Fitbit app
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, but switching from kid view to parent view in my app is glitchy. I eventually had to remove my fitbit I use less often, because it always defaulted to that one when switching back to parent view rather than the one in current use on my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: 3rd and last Fitbit Owned
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Fitbit Versa for $159 off of HSN and it quit working 1-2 months after getting it. Ordered Fitbit Ace 2 from Amazon and it stopped charging after 6 weeks. They sent me replacement and could never get it to sync with Fitbit app. DO NOT BUY. I rarely write reviews but the Fitbit name is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Dana B.

customer_reviews.title: My kiddo loves this
customer_reviews.text: Although I had to figure out how to switch from my fitbit app to his, I got it to work and am happy that this makes my kiddo happy. He is so proud of all the steps he takes each day! Great way for him to tell time and keep on track.
customer_reviews.author: Jessa Ratike

customer_reviews.title: These are alright.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was upset cause these do not track heart rate. Also I have not had an easy time trying to set up the family unit. I have not had an easy time creating the family unit.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this tracker! Great battery life. Lasts about 3 days between charges. Seems to be very accurate. Very durable and she’s used in the bathtub and shower and no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old grandson. He loves it and we compete on who gets the most steps. Yes, he always wins. His mother likes the sleep function to monitor his sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Tp

customer_reviews.title: Faulty band! Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I would NOT recommend this product! After 6 weeks of normal wear, the watch face popped out of the band and is lost. This is a KIDS fit bit and I’m so disappointed this could happen from normal wear. I’m outside the return window (though I only have a useless band to return) and I called Fitbit and they will do nothing. Buy something less expensive and sturdier and save yourself the headache and money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit could have built it better
customer_reviews.text: Mobile app is little hard to configure not working with chrome book No heart beat monitor:-( Silicon Band looks really great and better than many other . UI is also intuitive for kids to use
customer_reviews.author: knair

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitbit for kids
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old daughter got this for Christmas and loves it so far. Counts steps, has clock, timer, stop watch. Can change the clock faces. Just received an email for her weekly stats. Has reminders to get active if you haven’t been for an hour. Can set bedtime notifications too. Going to order different color bands for her to switch out. Nice size for kids too.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Mason

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! My son was running around the house the first night so he could make his goal. He likes the face that grow throughout the day!! Great motivator for a kid that loves video games
customer_reviews.author: lane hardgrave

customer_reviews.title: Good motivator for competitive children!
customer_reviews.text: Can't get my nephew off the couch. I bought him this because he's so competitive. He loves "beating me." Not only has he started moving more, but so have I because I want it to be somewhat of a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Adelaide Seiwert

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted two months
customer_reviews.text: During the time it was working my daughter enjoyed this product very much. However, after two months of utilizing, the Fitbit "locked up", and we could not see anything other than the time. I tried letting the battery run completely out and then recharge, but no luck.
